2021-06-12.name: Free Entrance Day to all Minnesota state parks
2021-06-12.summary: Entrance to all 75 Minnesota state parks and recreation areas is free today.

2021-06-12.name: Lilac Festival
2021-06-12.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2021-06-12.name: Butterfest
2021-06-12.summary: There's an arts and crafts show, flea market and carnival but also  a milking contest, firemen's water fight and a parade Sunday.

2021-06-12.name: Aquafest
2021-06-12.summary: The festival in this northwest Wisconsin lakes town includes a carnival, art fair, kids' fishing derby, car show, live bands and, on the last day, a parade followed by a water-ski show.

2021-06-12.name: Mount Horeb Summer Frolic
2021-06-12.summary: Just west of Madison, this town celebrates with a bean-bag toss, dog show, volleyball, craft-beer tent, Saturday fireworks and Sunday parade.Â

2021-06-12.name: Spring Lighthouse Festival
2021-06-12.summary: The Door County Maritime Museum in Sturgeon Bay offers tours of the peninsula's 11 lighthouses by foot, boat, trolley, minibus and airplane. Tickets go on sale to the public in March; some tours sell out quickly.

2021-06-12.name: Windsurfing Regatta & Music Festival
2021-06-12.summary: This breezy town in southwest Minnesota hosts windsurfing races on Lake Okabena and a free music festival. There will also be children's activities, a bike ride and a fun run.

2021-06-12.name: Walleye Weekend
2021-06-12.summary: In addition to a fishing tournament, this free family fest features live music on four stages, a Friday parade and strongman, volleyball and cornhole competitions, plus a Familyland for small children and a Teen Village with a climbing wall, giant obstacle course and henna tattoo parlor.

2021-06-12.name: Country Thunder Iowa Music Festival
2021-06-12.summary: The country-music festival in this town near Clear Lake features Lynyrd Skynrd, Morgan Wallan and Old Dominion. There's camping (and glamping) onsite.

2021-06-12.name: Lower Sioux Wacipi
2021-06-12.summary: This Lower Sioux Indian Community wacipi, or powwow, includes dancing, drumming, singing and food. Grand Entries are at 7 p.m. Friday, 1 and 7 p.m. Saturday and 1 p.m. Sunday. Everyone is welcome.

2021-06-12.name: Wine & Food Festival
2021-06-12.summary: Sample local wines and listen to music at this festival on the Leelanau Peninsula.

2021-06-12.name: PorchFest
2021-06-12.summary: During this afternoon music festival, 19 bands perform for 45 minutes each on porches around town. There will be food vendors, too.

2021-06-30.name: Riverfest
2021-06-30.summary: This riverfront festival includes music, magicians, dance, a water-ski show and fireworks by the La Crosse Skyrockers. Headliners include Randy Houser, Troy Cartwright and Chris Kroeze.

2021-06-04.name: Lilac Festival
2021-06-04.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2021-06-04.name: Spring Art Tour
2021-06-04.summary: Artists open their studios in Mount Horeb and other towns in the Wisconsin River valley: Mazomanie, Black Earth, Cross Plains, Blue Mounds and Verona.

2021-06-04.name: Sun Drop Dayz
2021-06-04.summary: This northwoods town offers music, kids' activities, a car show, flea market, magic show and craft fair, plus samples of the locally made Sun Drops soda.

2021-06-05.name: Lilac Festival
2021-06-05.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2021-06-05.name: Spring Art Tour
2021-06-05.summary: Artists open their studios in Mount Horeb and other towns in the Wisconsin River valley: Mazomanie, Black Earth, Cross Plains, Blue Mounds and Verona.

2021-06-05.name: Sun Drop Dayz
2021-06-05.summary: This northwoods town offers music, kids' activities, a car show, flea market, magic show and craft fair, plus samples of the locally made Sun Drops soda.

2021-06-05.name: Wisconsin state-parks open house
2021-06-05.summary: Visit a Wisconsin state park without paying the daily vehicle fee, $8-$13 for residents and $11-$16 for non-residents.

2021-06-05.name: Outta Sight Kite Flight
2021-06-05.summary: See giant show kites and stunt-flying demonstrations along Lake Michigan in Kennedy Park. There will be kite-making workshops and kite-flying lessons and contests, and the first 100 kids will receive free kites.

2021-06-05.name: Reggae Fest
2021-06-05.summary: The Trempealeau Hotel hosts this easygoing festival on the banks of the Mississippi.Â

2021-06-06.name: Lilac Festival
2021-06-06.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2021-06-06.name: Spring Art Tour
2021-06-06.summary: Artists open their studios in Mount Horeb and other towns in the Wisconsin River valley: Mazomanie, Black Earth, Cross Plains, Blue Mounds and Verona.

2021-06-06.summary: Visit a Wisconsin state park without paying the daily vehicle fee, $8-$13 for residents and $11-$16 for non-residents.

2021-06-06.name: Outta Sight Kite Flight
2021-06-06.summary: See giant show kites and stunt-flying demonstrations along Lake Michigan in Kennedy Park. There will be kite-making workshops and kite-flying lessons and contests, and the first 100 kids will receive free kites.

2021-06-06.name: Ride the Drive
2021-06-06.summary: This year, the car-free routes are spread out between Marlborough, Wingra, Kennedy and Warner parks, with stops for activities, food and music. You can ride, walk or skate.

2021-06-06.name: Model A Day
2021-06-06.summary: In this hamlet near Lake Geneva, on the Illinois border, Model A's from the 1920s and '30s line main street, and people dressed as gangsters and flappers promenade in front of historic buildings.

2021-06-22.name: Swedish Days Festival
2021-06-22.summary: This Fox River town on the western edge of Chicago offers music and a carnival, car show, chocolate craw and Swedish cottage walk.Â

2021-06-24.name: Country Fest
2021-06-24.summary: This year's big outdoor festival near Chippewa Falls features Thomas Rhett, Dierks Bentley and Kane Brown.

2021-06-24.name: Lakes Jam
2021-06-24.summary: Brothers Osborne, Jon Pardi and Ratt are among the headliners at this music-and-camping festival at Brainerd International Raceway.

2021-06-25.name: Swedish Days Festival

2021-06-25.name: Musky Fest
2021-06-25.summary: There will be a carnival, crafts, watermelon- and ice cream-eating contests and lots of festivities downtown, capped by the 1 p.m. Sunday parade.

2021-06-25.name: Water Ski Days
2021-06-25.summary: There's music, an arts and crafts fair and, on Sunday, a parade followed by a water-ski show on Lake Pepin, where water-skiing was invented.

2021-06-25.name: Des Moines Arts Festival
2021-06-25.summary: This big, juried arts fair at Western Gateway Park downtown includes street theater, live music and a film festival.

2021-06-25.name: Cedar Basin Jazz Festival
2021-06-25.summary: There will be 42 hours of free entertainment in Sturgis Park, including a Sunday morning gospel set and a jazz brunch.

2021-06-25.name: Sol Grass Music Festival
2021-06-25.summary: This bluegrass festival is off the Door Peninsula, and tickets include tent camping.

2021-06-26.name: Spring Iowa Barn Tour
2021-06-26.summary: This tour of historic barns concentrates on barns in the rolling Grant Wood country of eastern Iowa, including the Anamosa State Penitentiary barns.

2021-06-14.name: Jaycee Water Carnival
2021-06-14.summary: This town just west of Minneapolis, on the Crow River, celebrates with a boat parade, fireworks, human foosball tournament, canoe races, duck races, a car show and parade Sunday.

2021-06-15.name: Jaycee Water Carnival
2021-06-15.summary: This town just west of Minneapolis, on the Crow River, celebrates with a boat parade, fireworks, human foosball tournament, canoe races, duck races, a car show and parade Sunday.

2021-06-16.name: Jaycee Water Carnival
2021-06-16.summary: This town just west of Minneapolis, on the Crow River, celebrates with a boat parade, fireworks, human foosball tournament, canoe races, duck races, a car show and parade Sunday.

2021-06-16.name: Steamboat Days
2021-06-16.summary: The main event is the 12:31 p.m. Sunday parade, one of the region's largest. There's also a carnival, craft show, power-boat races and car show.

2021-06-16.name: Perham Turtle Fest
2021-06-16.summary: This town in the northwest Minnesota lakes region features turtle races, a rodeo, music, trolley rides, inflatable games and a parade Friday.

2021-06-16.name: Ice Cream Days
2021-06-16.summary: The festival in this northwest Iowa town, home of Blue Bunny ice cream, includes an art fair, old-fashioned children's games, architectural tours, a polo match, airplane and helicopter stunts and a parade at 9 a.m. Saturday. And the ice cream is free.

2021-06-17.name: Rose Festival
2021-06-17.summary: This town east of Ames calls itself Iowa's rose capital, and it celebrates with garden tours, children's games, a truck and tractor pull, music, fireworks and a parade at 10 a.m. Saturday.

2021-06-18.summary: Eagle Ridge Resort hosts two balloon races, two night glows and rides for the public.Â

2021-06-18.name: More on 34
2021-06-18.summary: A 131-mile yard sale along U.S. 34 from Aurora to Galesburg, with events in many towns.

2021-06-18.name: Winstock Country Festival
2021-06-18.summary: Luke Combs and Darius Rucker headline this festival just west of Minneapolis.

2021-06-18.name: Northwoods Blues Festival
2021-06-18.summary: The blues festival is at Riverfront Park.Â
